THE M2MI LIBRARY

The M2MI Library is the API for Many-to-Many Invocation (M2MI), a new paradigm for building collaborative systems that run in wireless proximal ad hoc networks of fixed and mobile computing devices.

See:
          Description

Packages
edu.rit.classfile Package edu.rit.classfile is the RIT Classfile Library for analyzing and synthesizing class files.
edu.rit.classfile.unittest Package edu.rit.classfile.unittest contains unit test programs that demonstrate how to use the RIT Classfile Library.
edu.rit.m2mi Package edu.rit.m2mi is the API for Many-to-Many Invocation (M2MI).
edu.rit.m2mi.life3 Package edu.rit.m2mi.life3 is a program for John Horton Conway's Game of Life using M2MI.
edu.rit.m2mi.matrix1 Package edu.rit.m2mi.matrix1 is a program for computing a matrix product using M2MI with omnihandles.
edu.rit.m2mi.matrix2 Package edu.rit.m2mi.matrix2 is a program for computing a matrix product using M2MI with multihandles.
edu.rit.m2mi.nbodies1 Package edu.rit.m2mi.nbodies1 is a program for the N Bodies Problem using M2MI.
edu.rit.m2mi.test Package edu.rit.m2mi.test contains test and demonstration programs for distributed applications based on Many-to-Many Invocation (M2MI).
edu.rit.m2mp The M2MP API is a prototype class library implementing the Many-to-Many Protocol (M2MP).
edu.rit.m2mp.debug Package edu.rit.m2mp.debug contains channels useful for debugging an M2MP application.
edu.rit.m2mp.ip Package edu.rit.m2mp.ip contains Many-to-Many Protocol (M2MP) channel implementations that use UDP datagrams to convey M2MP packets.
edu.rit.m2mp.packet Package edu.rit.m2mp.packet contains classes that encapsulate the packets in the Many-to-Many Protocol (M2MP).
edu.rit.m2mp.test Package edu.rit.m2mp.test contains test programs for the M2MP API.
edu.rit.util Package edu.rit.util contains general utility components.

 

The M2MI Library is the API for Many-to-Many Invocation (M2MI), a new paradigm for building collaborative systems that run in wireless proximal ad hoc networks of fixed and mobile computing devices.

M2MI Library Version 02-Jul-2002

Table of Contents

1. Installation
2. Getting Started
3. License
4. Revision History

1. Installation

The M2MI Library requires Java Development Kit (JDK) 1.4.0.

To install the M2MI Library, just unpack the JAR file containing the M2MI distribution, "m2miapi20020702.jar". The distribution expands into a subdirectory named "m2miapi20020702".

Documentation is stored under directory "m2miapi20020702/doc"; point your HTML browser to that directory.

Java source files and class files are stored under directory "m2miapi20020702/lib"; add that directory to your classpath when you run the programs.

2. Getting Started

The M2MI Library comprises three principal packages; see each package’s documentation for further information:

  • Package edu.rit.m2mi provides M2MI itself.

  • Package edu.rit.m2mp provides the Many-to-Many Protocol (M2MP), which is used to transport M2MI messages.

  • Package edu.rit.classfile provides the RIT Classfile Library (RCL), which is used to synthesize M2MI proxy classes.

To get started with M2MI, read the documentation for package edu.rit.m2mi and try the examples provided.

4. Revision History

02-Jul-2002
Changed the channel implementation used to broadcast M2MP messages to all processes on the local host so it will work properly on Sun Solaris systems as well as Linux systems; the implementation is now contained in classes edu.rit.m2mp.ip.M2MPRouter (revised) and edu.rit.m2mp.ip.M2MPRouterChannel (new). Changed the chat demo application (class edu.rit.m2mi.test.ChatDemo) to put the user interface in a separate class from the exported chat object.

07-Jun-2002
Initial version. Released under the terms of the GNU General Public License.
